name: Arroz Con Pollo with Wings and Chipotles!
description: This version of Arroz con Pollo takes plenty of shortcuts but it still arrives at a delicious home-cooked meal!  I hope it inspires you to add some quick eats to your weeknight meal routine :)
recipeIngredient: 1-2  chipotles in adobo (or less for a milder version)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat up a glug of oil over medium-high heat in a small saucepan or soup pot.  Add the chicken wings and brown each side for a few minutes.  Once browned you can set the chicken pieces aside for now.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat up a glug of oil over medium-high heat in a small saucepan or soup pot.  Add the chicken wings and brown each side for a few minutes.  Once browned you can set the chicken pieces aside for now.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1/2 cup uncooked rice to the pan.  Give it a good stir and cook over medium heat for a few minutes or until it starts to turn golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1/2 cup uncooked rice to the pan.  Give it a good stir and cook over medium heat for a few minutes or until it starts to turn golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: As the rice cooks add the following ingredients to a blender or food processor:  1-2 plum tomatoes, 1/4 onion, 1 peeled garlic clove, 1-2 chipotles in adobo.  Combine well.  Notes:  be sure to rinse and de-stem the tomato(s), and feel free to use only half of a chipotle for a milder version.  I also usually scrape out the seeds of chipotles but this is optional.  More info on working with chipotles in adobo.
recipeInstructions.name: As the rice cooks add the following ingredients to a blender or food processor:  1-2 plum tomatoes, 1/4 onion, 1 peeled garlic clove, 1-2 chipotles in adobo.  Combine well.  Notes:  be sure to rinse and de-stem the tomato(s), and feel free to use only half of a chipotle for a milder version.  I also usually scrape out the seeds of chipotles but this is optional.  More info on working with chipotles in adobo.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the rice is starting to turn golden brown you can add the blended tomato-chipotle mixture to the pan.  Let it simmer for a couple minutes, stirring regularly.   Then add the remaining ingredients:  1 teaspoon Mexican oregano, pinch of cumin (optional), 1/4 teaspoon salt, freshly cracked black pepper, and 1 cup stock.  Combine well and bring this mixture up to a boil.  I usually take a final taste for salt level at this point -- I added another generous pinch of salt but keep in mind this will depend on which stock you're using.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the rice is starting to turn golden brown you can add the blended tomato-chipotle mixture to the pan.  Let it simmer for a couple minutes, stirring regularly.   Then add the remaining ingredients:  1 teaspoon Mexican oregano, pinch of cumin (optional), 1/4 teaspoon salt, freshly cracked black pepper, and 1 cup stock.  Combine well and bring this mixture up to a boil.  I usually take a final taste for salt level at this point -- I added another generous pinch of salt but keep in mind this will depend on which stock you're using.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the browned chicken pieces to the pan, bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to a simmer ('low' on my stove).  Let cook for 20-25 minutes or until all of the liquid is absorbed.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the browned chicken pieces to the pan, bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to a simmer ('low' on my stove).  Let cook for 20-25 minutes or until all of the liquid is absorbed.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the liquid is absorbed you can set it aside and let it sit in its own steam for a   few minutes, covered.  Then it's time to serve it up.  Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Once the liquid is absorbed you can set it aside and let it sit in its own steam for a   few minutes, covered.  Then it's time to serve it up.  Enjoy!
